paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the methylation patterns and polymorphisms in the BRCA2 gene in relation to sporadic breast cancer, identifying a specific polymorphism and its association with disease susceptibility.

patients.demographics: female patients aged 25 to 77 years, median age 48 years

functional_data.summary: The study indicates that the BRCA2 -26 G/A 5'UTR polymorphism is associated with susceptibility to sporadic breast tumors.

variants.segregation_data: The polymorphism was observed in the context of methylation patterns but specific segregation data was not provided.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the potential role of BRCA2 methylation in breast cancer development.
key_quotes: The observation of BRCA2 -26 G/A 5'UTR polymorphism concomitant with the presence of methylation in the promoter region was novel and emerged as a strong candidate for susceptibility to sporadic breast tumors.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper specifically mentioned a variant in the BRCA2 gene.
